Package eecs2030.lab3

Class Turtle

  • java.lang.Object
    • eecs2030.lab3.Turtle
  • public class Turtle
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that supports turtle graphics. A turtle moves between two points in a straight line drawing the line as it moves.

    A turtle has-a Point2 instance that represents the position of the turtle, and a Color instance that represents the current pen color. The turtle maintains ownership of its position at all times.

    Author:
    EECS2030 Fall 2016-17

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Turtle()
      Create a turtle at location (0.5, 0.5) with an angle of 0.0 degrees and a pen color of Color.BLACK.

      Create a turtle at location position with an angle of 0.0 degrees and a pen color of Color.BLACK.
      Turtle​(eecs2030.lab3.Point2 position, double angle)
      Create a turtle at location position with an angle of angle degrees and a pen color of Color.BLACK.
      Turtle​(eecs2030.lab3.Point2 position, double angle, java.awt.Color c)
      CCreate a turtle with the given starting position, angle, and pen color.
      Turtle​(Turtle other)
      Create a turtle from another turtle.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Turtle

        public Turtle()
        Create a turtle at location (0.5, 0.5) with an angle of 0.0 degrees and a pen color of Color.BLACK.

      • Turtle

        public Turtle​(eecs2030.lab3.Point2 position)
        Create a turtle at location position with an angle of 0.0 degrees and a pen color of Color.BLACK. The turtle is responsible for its own position.

        The starting position must be inside the square with corners (0.0, 0.0) and (1.0, 1.0), otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        position - A Point2 to give to turtle.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the starting position is not in the square with corners (0.0, 0.0) and (1.0, 1.0)

      • Turtle

        public Turtle​(eecs2030.lab3.Point2 position,
              double angle)
        Create a turtle at location position with an angle of angle degrees and a pen color of Color.BLACK. The starting position must be inside the square with corners (0.0, 0.0) and (1.0, 1.0), otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        position - the starting position of the turtle
        angle - the angle in degrees from the x axis that the turtle is facing in
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the starting position is not in the square with corners (0.0, 0.0) and (1.0, 1.0)

      • Turtle

        public Turtle​(eecs2030.lab3.Point2 position,
              double angle,
              java.awt.Color c)
        CCreate a turtle with the given starting position, angle, and pen color. The starting position must be inside the square with corners (0.0, 0.0) and (1.0, 1.0), otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        position - the starting position of the turtle
        angle - the angle in degrees from the x axis that the turtle is facing in
        c - the pen color
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the starting position is not in the square with corners (0.0, 0.0) and (1.0, 1.0)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the pen color c is null

      • Turtle

        public Turtle​(Turtle other)
        Create a turtle from another turtle. The created turtle is initialized having the same position, angle, and pen color as the other turtle, but moves independently of the other turtle.
        Parameters:
        other - the turtle to copy

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
        Compares this turtle with another object for equality. This turtle can be equal to only other turtles.

        Two turtles are equal if their positions, directions, and pen colors are all equal; otherwise, the turtles are not equal.

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - An object to compare for equality.
        Returns:
        True if the position, direction, and pen color of this turtle are equal to the position, direction, and pen color of the other turtle, and false otherwise.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hash code for this turtle.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a hash code for this turtle

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this turtle. The string representation is:
        1. the position of the turtle (as given by Point2.toString ), followed by
        2. a comma and a space, followed by
        3. the direction, followed by
        4. a space, the string "degrees", a space, and a comma, followed by
        5. the pen color (as given by Color.toString)
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of this turtle
